_exec_summary.SummaryText:
March 6, 2009
Risk Management Plan-Executive Summary
Facility: Burroughs Ag Services Minonk, IL 61760
Contact: Ray Cirks
Phone:  (309) 432-2577

1.  Facility Policy.

       The owners, management and employees of Burroughs Ag Services are committed to the prevention of any
accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia. If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to
work with the local fire department, Woodford County LEPC, and other authorities, to mitigate and minimize the
impacts of the release to the people and the environment.

2.  Facility Information.

      The primary activity at the facility is the distribution of products to farmers. The fertilizer product,
anhydrous ammonia is received, stored and distributed for direct application as a nutrient for crop production.
Anhydrous ammonia is stored in tanks designed for this purpose.

3.  The Worst-Case Release Scenario and the Alternate Release Scenario.

      An analysis of the potential off-site consequences of hypothetical worst-case and alternative-case
accidental rleases have been addressed in our Hazard Asseement and information is in our Risk
Management Program.

4.  Accidental Release Prevention Program.

      The facility is in compliance with the provisions of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health
Administration(OSHA), 29CFR 1910.11, "Storage and handling of anhydrous ammonia" and our state
regulations covering anhydrous ammonia. The OSHA standard is reference int this RMP Registration Form,
see Section 8.3(b).

5.  Five Year Accidental History.

     There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that have caused
any deaths, injuries or significant property damage at the facility: nor to our knowledge has THERE BEEN ANY
ACCIDENTAL RELEASES resulting in off-site deaths, injuries, evacuations, property damage, or environmental
damage.

6.  Emergency Action Plan.

     The facility has:
     
     a.  A written emergency action plan, in accordanc

e with OSHA standard 29 CFR 1910.36

     b. Provided state and local authorities with the emergency planning and Community right-to Know
information as required under SARA Title III(EPCRA)

     c. If a large release of anhydrous ammonia takes place at the facility, the required response action is to
evacuate the area of the spill and call 911 and all applicable emergency number listed in our Emergency
Action Plan.

7.   Planned Changes to Improve Safety.

      Safety improvements is an on-going process at the facility.  Periodic evaluations are preformed to assess
the conditions OF THE FACILITY.  Ther are no additional specific safety recommendations regarding storage
or use of anhydrous ammonia for implemention at this time.
